title: S grades and Sloppy looks
body:
This forum board is very confusing. I don't know if it's because there's too much going on or if the wrong colors are being used but I find the whole League of Legends website to be very cluttered and confusing. I love the game I'm just commenting on how everything looks the same and there's no sense of priority sections or options.

NOW with my actual post:

Where can I find official documentation of say S grade requirements?

I played as Teemo and ended 22/9/36. Got 750XP but not even an S-.
I'd really like to know what it OFFICIALLY takes to get an S-.

I know we have participation points but I don't see a place to view that. I'm going off of a game where they did not award me a grade at all. Support told me there was no errors.

http://i63.tinypic.com/wl2nhd.png

Might I add that this happens to my score every other game or so. Either no grade or no xp shown.

replies.body:
There isn't a list of S grade requirements. 

The main reason is that the system doesn't work off a checklist. It looks at what champ and what lane you're playing and compares your gameplay against others of the same champion and lane. To get an S you need to have performed in the top percentage of those players. If you didn't get an S, that means someone out there had a better overall game. Be sure to read up on how mastery works in the [**champion mastery guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204211284).

750 experience gain is most likely due to your first win of the day mission added to the experience gained for the game. S rank is determined based on how good you do with a particular champion in a particular role in comparison to other people who have played that same champion in that same role in the past. If you're trying to get S rank for mastery 6 or 7 tokens, you can't earn those from ARAM unfortunately.

I had also made a post yesterday questioning why some matches don't show grades or experience in match history.
